messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Great Book on Homeschooling Math
messages.msgSnippet: But the book apparently talks about teaching math. How does she suggest unschoolers approach it if it s about teaching? Robin B.
messages.messageBody:
But the book apparently talks about "teaching" math. How does she
suggest unschoolers approach it if it's about teaching?

Robin B.

> I just read a great book called How to Homeschool Math-even if you
> Hate Fractions by Robin Padron. She talks specifically how
> unschoolers can approach this. She also opened my eyes about why so
> many kids really hate math
>
>

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Great Book on Homeschooling Math
messages.msgSnippet: -=-She talks specifically how unschoolers can approach this. She also opened my eyes about why so many kids really hate math-=- What kind of things did she say
messages.messageBody:
-=-She talks specifically how unschoolers can approach this. She also opened my eyes about why so many kids really hate math-=-

What kind of things did she say that surprised you, or inspired you?

Sandra

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Great Book on Homeschooling Math
messages.msgSnippet: I just read a great book called How to Homeschool Math-even if you Hate Fractions by Robin Padron.  She talks specifically how unschoolers can approach this.
messages.messageBody: I just read a great book called How to Homeschool Math-even if you Hate Fractions by Robin Padron. She talks specifically how unschoolers can approach this. She also opened my eyes about why so many kids really hate math
